title: European stocks slide amid rising political tensions as traders await US-China talks; Qiagen plunges 20% after sales miss
text:
European markets turned negative Tuesday morning as investors await news out of high-level trade talks between the U.S. and China, set to commence on Thursday.

The pan-European Stoxx 600 slipped 0.3% with financial services shedding 0.8% to lead losses as most sectors and major bourses entered the red.

Hopes for significant progress on trade seemed to diminish on Monday after the U.S. Commerce Department blacklisted 28 Chinese companies over alleged involvement in the abuse of ethnic Uighurs in China's Xinjiang province.

Tensions between Washington and Beijing were further strained by controversy over a tweet from the general manager of the Houston Rockets, in support of pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, was rebuked by the National Basketball Association following a furious backlash from mainland China.

Hong Kong chief executive Carrie Lam on Tuesday refused to rule out seeking help from central government to deal with the ongoing mass protests.
